inventory:
详细清单 
a complete list of the things that are in a place
shrine:
圣地；圣祠；神庙 
a place connected with a holy person or event where people go to worship
dictate:
命令，发号施令，强行规定 
to say or state (something) with authority or power

口述 
to speak or read (something) to a person who writes it down or to a machine that records it
mandatory:
命令的 
required by a law or rule
contraption:
奇异的机械；奇特的装置 
machine or piece of equipment that looks strange 
22
inflammatory:
发炎的 
causing or having inflammation
perseverance:
坚持不懈 
the quality that allows someone to continue trying to do something even though it is difficult
volubility:
健谈，口若悬河 
the quality of talking fluently, readily, or incessantly; talkativeness
stroll:
漫步 
to walk slowly in usually a pleasant and relaxed way
breach:
违背 
a failure to do what is required by a law, an agreement, or a duty

违反，破坏 
to fail to do what is required by (something, such as a law or agreement)
barren:
荒芜的，贫瘠的 
having very few plants; not suitable for plants
circumvent:
规避，逃避 规则或限制 to avoid a problem or rule that restricts you, especially in a clever or dishonest way – used 
to show disapproval

躲避，绕行 
to avoid something by changing the direction in which you are travelling
affiliate:
使紧密联系，隶属于 
to closely connect (something or yourself) with or to something (such as a program or 
organization) as a member or partner
evocative:
唤起回忆的 
bringing thoughts, memories, or feelings into the mind
ingenuous:
单纯的；天真的 
honest, innocent and willing to trust people
translucent:
半透明的 
allowing light to pass through but not transparent
precept:
思想、行为的准则，规范 
a rule about how to behave or what to think
impostor:
假冒者；冒名顶替者 
a person who deceives others by pretending to be someone else 
23
paternal:
父亲的 
of or relating to a father
denounce:
谴责 
to publicly state that someone or something is bad or wrong
remonstrance:
抗议；抱怨 
a protest or complaint
provocative:
刺激的，煽动性的，引发争论，激起兴趣的 
causing discussion, thought, argument, etc.
sordid:
卑鄙的 
very bad or dishonest
temperance:
节制 
the practice of always controlling your actions, thoughts, or feelings so that you do not eat 
or drink too much, become too angry, etc.

戒酒 
the practice of drinking little or no alcohol
resolute:
坚决的 
very determined; having or showing a lot of determination
bustle:
喧闹，活跃 
to move or go in a busy or hurried way

忙乱，忙碌 
to have a lot of busy activity
detriment:
伤害；损害；造成伤害或损害的事物 
the act of causing harm or damage; something that causes harm or damage
evacuate:
疏散，撤退 
to remove (someone) from a dangerous place
unfounded:
没有根据的，没有证据的 
lacking a sound basis; groundless, unwarranted
brisk:
兴隆的轻快的 
marked by much activity

轻快的 
moving or speaking quickly; quick and efficient 
24
imbibe:
喝，饮 酒等 
to drink something, especially alcohol

吸收，接受 信息等 
to absorb something, especially information
pinpoint:
明确指出，确定 位置或时间 
to find and show the exact position of somebody/something or the exact time that 
something happened

准确解释或说明 
to be able to give the exact reason for something or to describe something exactly
preoccupation:
关注的事物 
something that you give all or most of your attention to

全神贯注 
a state in which you give all your attention to something
handicap:
生理或智力上的残障，残疾 
a permanent physical or mental condition that makes it difficult or impossible to use a 
particular part of your body or mind

阻碍，妨碍 
to make success or progress difficult for (someone)
subjugate:
征服；使服从 
to defeat and gain control of (someone or something) by the use of force; to conquer and 
gain the obedience of (a group of people, a country, etc.)
hybrid:
杂交植物，杂交动物 
an animal or plant that is produced from two animals or plants of different kinds
morbid:
病态的 
not healthy or normal

与疾病有关的 
relating to unpleasant subjects (such as death)
robust:
坚定的，坚固的 
strong and healthy
pollster:
民意测验主办人；民意调查员 
a person who makes or asks the questions in an opinion poll
mouthpiece:
代言人，喉舌 
someone who speaks for another person or for a group or organization 
25
chauvinistic:
盲目爱国的，沙文主义的 
believing that your country, sex, etc., is better than any other; showing or filled with chauvinism
fiscal:
政府财政的 
of or relating to money and especially to the money a government, business, or 
organization earns, spends, and owes
indispensable:
不可缺少的 
absolutely necessary, essential, vital, cannot be done without
punch:
打孔 
to make a hole in (something, such as a ticket) by using a special tool

重击 
to hit (someone or something) hard with your fist
trite:
陈腐的，老一套的 
not interesting or effective because of being used too often; not fresh or original
stifle:
压制 
to stop (someone) from doing or expressing something
deciduous:
指树木每年落叶的 
having leaves that fall off every year
tact:
处事、言谈等的老练，圆通，得体，乖巧 
the ability to deal with difficult or embarrassing situations carefully and without doing or 
saying anything that will annoy or upset other people
quirk:
怪癖；古怪的性格 
an unusual habit or way of behaving

偶然发生的奇事，趣事 
something strange that happens by chance
queasy:
恶心的 
having a sick feeling in the stomach

稍感紧张的 
having an unpleasantly nervous or doubtful feeling
deformity:
畸形 
a condition in which part of the body does not have the normal or expected shape 
26
summon:
传唤，传讯 出庭；召唤 
to order somebody to appear in a court of law; to order somebody to come to you

召集，召开 会议 
to arrange an official meeting

吁求；请求；争取 
to call for or try to obtain something

鼓起；振作；使出 
to make an effort to produce a particular quality in yourself, especially when you find it difficult
fertility:
土地的肥沃；肥力；丰产 
the quality or state of being fertile 
27
relish:
喜爱 
a feeling of liking something

享受 
to enjoy or take pleasure in (something)
replicate:
复制 
to repeat or copy (something) exactly
discordant:
不一致的 
not agreeing; not in harmony
formidable:
令人畏惧的 
very powerful or strong; deserving serious attention and respect
delusion:
妄想 
a false idea or belief that is caused by mental illness

错觉，谬见，误会 
a belief that is not true; a false idea
filament:
电灯泡的灯丝；丝极 
a thin wire in a light bulb that produces light when electricity is passed through it

细丝；丝状物 
a long thin piece of something that looks like a thread
plight:
保证，订婚 
to pledge or promise solemnly (one's faith or loyalty); to promise to marry someone

困境 
a very bad or difficult situation
savage:
野蛮人，残暴的人 
a person who has a way of life that is simple and not highly advanced

野蛮的，残暴的 
very cruel or violent
logistical:
运筹的，后勤的 
of or relating to logistics

在组织上的 
the things that must be done to plan and organize a complicated activity or event that 
involves many people
bribery:
贿赂 
the act or crime of giving or accepting a bribe 
28
trespass:
擅自进入，非法侵入他人土地 
to go on someone's land without permission

非法侵入 
the crime of going on someone's land without permission
compact:
使紧密结合 
to press (something) so that it is harder and fills less space

紧凑的 
closely or firmly packed or joined together
chastise:
训斥 
to criticize (someone) harshly for doing something wrong
imperceptible:
难以察觉的 
impossible to see or notice
approachable:
可接近的 
able to be reached or approached
ingenuity:
独创力；聪明才智；心灵手巧 
the ability to invent things or solve problems in clever new ways
testify:
证实；作证 
to show that something is true or real; to give proof of something
exacerbate:
使恶化 
to make (a bad situation, a problem, etc.) worse
advent:
出现，到来 
the time when something begins or arrives; the first appearance of something
legible:
字迹清晰的 
capable of being read; clear enough to be read
upturn:
回升；好转；改善；提高 
a situation in which something improves or increases over a period of time
receptive:
对新思想或建议乐于接受的 
willing to listen to or accept ideas, suggestions, etc.
adroit:
熟练的 
very clever or skillful 
29
amorphous:
无固定形状的 
having no definite or clear shape or form

杂乱的 
lacking organization or unity
spectrum:
光谱；频谱 
the group of colors that a ray of light can be separated into including red, orange, yellow, 
green, blue, indigo, and violet;the colors that can be seen in a rainbow

范围 
a complete range of different opinions, people, etc.
